children.text: The drawings we have been provided with show the overall house slab dimensions from front-to-back, and side-to-side etc, which we have check measured, and can confirm that it closely matches what has been documented on the drawings.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.03 Setting out the site states that
‘A building set out is defective where the set out has failed to comply with the requirements of the approved drawings’
, and clause 2.06 Building dimensions states that
‘Departures from documented external dimensions of buildings are defects if they exceed L/200 where L is the documented overall length of wall, or 5 mm, whichever is the greater ’ .

This item is to confirm that the house slab overall dimensions are correct (within the allowable tolerances), and there is no action required from the builder at this stage in relation to this issue. Once the wall frames have been installed, we will be able to check if there are any frame overhangs or room size issues.
